result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle John Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape-Criminal Arrest [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-Consecutive to current sentence with Winnebago Cases 14CF130 and 14CF476.
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Consecutive to: Winnebago Cases 14CF130 & 14CF476

superMiscConds.notes:
$268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF230.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF230.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
-Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS Assessment and Agent.
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.

-State to provide restitution worksheet wihtin 10 days and Attorney Peterson has another 10 days to provide objections.
-Restitution to be determined.

supervisions.notes:
Count 2 read-in and dismissed.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

records.addlTxt: from Atty Peterson to the jail regarding speaking with Defendant by phone. eif

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:   Megan E. Kelly   DF ATTY:  Melissa M. Petersen   DF:  Kyle John Peterson appeared from jail. Case called at 3:55 p.m. ADA McKinley received copy of PSI. No changes proposed. Atty Petersen argues Paragraph 15 of the PSI. Court received alternate PSI filed by Atty Petersen. No objection by the state. Corrections noted by  Atty Petersen. ADA McKinley gives sentencing recommendations. State is in compliance with victims rights. Defense has not received a copy of the restitution worksheet. Atty Petersen gives sentencing arguments. Requesting restitution portion be left open. Defendant makes statement. Court notes letter received by victim filed in co-defendant's case. State to be provide restitution worksheet within 10 days. Atty Petersen has 10 additional days to provide any objection.

- Bifercated sentence. 4 years total confinement.

- 1 year initial confinement consecutive to current sentence with cases 14CF130 and 14CF176 in Winnebago Co. 3 years extended supervision. 0 days credit

- Restitution in the amount to be determined.

- Eligible for the Substance Abuse Program and Challenge Incarceration Program

- DNA Sample and Surcharge

- Court costs

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-   Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections

-  No possession of firearms

-   Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.

Court will hold off on scheduling. On 15CF230 Atty. Lida Bannink updates the court. DE pleads NG on counts. Waives speedy trial. Court will hold off on sched. 15CF229 with Atty. Jeff Kemp.
